chainId.description: The chain ID.
The chain ID.

Transition.description: A transition represents a change in the status of a transaction intent.

to.description: The transaction recipient or contract address.

data.description: A contract hashed method call with encoded args.

gas.description: The gas limit for the transaction.

maxFeePerGas.description: Total fee per gas (in wei), inclusive of `maxPriorityFeePerGas`. Only applies to EIP-1559 Transactions.

maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: Max priority fee per gas (in wei). Only applies to EIP-1559 Transactions.

paymaster.description: Address of the paymaster account that will pay the fees.

value.description: Value in wei sent with this transaction.

callData.description: The data to pass to the `sender` during the main execution call.

callGasLimit.description: The amount of gas to allocate the main execution call

initCode.description: Account init code. Only for new accounts.

preVerificationGas.description: Extra gas to pay the bundler.

signature.description: Data passed into the account to verify authorization.

verificationGasLimit.description: The amount of gas to allocate for the verification step.

callData.description: The data to pass to the `sender` during the main execution call.

callGasLimit.description: The amount of gas to allocate the main execution call

factory.description: Account init code. Only for new accounts.

preVerificationGas.description: Extra gas to pay the bundler.

signature.description: Data passed into the account to verify authorization.

verificationGasLimit.description: The amount of gas to allocate for the verification step.

UserOperationV9.description:
V9 UserOperation extends V8 with paymasterSignature field.
paymasterSignature enables parallelizable Paymaster signing -
data can be passed to the Paymaster after the UserOperation is signed by the wallet.

callData.description: The data to pass to the `sender` during the main execution call.

callGasLimit.description: The amount of gas to allocate the main execution call

factory.description: Account init code. Only for new accounts.

preVerificationGas.description: Extra gas to pay the bundler.

signature.description: Data passed into the account to verify authorization.

verificationGasLimit.description: The amount of gas to allocate for the verification step.

paymasterSignature.description:
Paymaster signature - enables parallelizable signing.
This field does not affect the UserOperation hash, allowing
the sender and paymaster to sign in parallel.

AccountAbstractionV9Details.description: V9 details - extends V8 with paymasterSignature for parallelizable signing

to.description: The transaction recipient or contract address.

data.description: A contract hashed method call with encoded args.

gas.description: The gas limit for the transaction.

maxFeePerGas.description: Total fee per gas (in wei), inclusive of `maxPriorityFeePerGas`. Only applies to EIP-1559 Transactions.

maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: Max priority fee per gas (in wei). Only applies to EIP-1559 Transactions.

value.description: Value in wei sent with this transaction.

createdAt.description: The unix timestamp in seconds when the transactionIntent was created.

blockNumber.description: The block height (number) of the block including the transaction of this log.

transactionHash.description: The transaction hash of the transaction of this log.

l1GasUsed.description: The l1 gas used by the transaction of this log.

gasUsed.description: The gas used by the transaction of this log.

gasFee.description: The gas fee by the transaction of this log.

l1GasFee.description: The l1 gas fee by the transaction of this log.

status.description: The status of the transaction of this log.

logs.description: The logs of the transaction of this log.

to.description: The address of the contract of this log.

error.description: The error of the transaction of this log.

to.description: The address of the recipient of native tokens. Use *only* to transfer native tokens. If you provide one of a `pla_...`,  or `acc_...` it will be converted to the corresponding address.

value.description:
The value intended to be sent with the transaction. Should be a stringified number in WEI (i.e. factor 10^18).
*

contract.description: The contract ID you want to interact with. Must have been added to Openfort first, starts with `con_`.

functionName.description: The function name of the contract. Accepts a a function signature as well (e.g. mint(address)).

functionArgs.description: The function arguments of the contract, in string format. If you provide one of a `pla_...`, `con_...` or `acc_...` it will be converted to the corresponding address.

dataSuffix.description: Data to append to the end of the calldata. Useful for [adding a "domain" tag](https://opensea.notion.site/opensea/Seaport-Order-Attributions-ec2d69bf455041a5baa490941aad307f)

data.description: The encoded calldata of the contract.

updatedAt.description: The unix timestamp in seconds when the transactionIntent was created.

chainId.description: The chain ID.

transitions.description: Transition of statuses the transaction has gone through.

details.description: Specific transaction details based on its type

limit.description: Specifies the maximum number of records to return.

skip.description: Specifies the offset for the first records to return.

order.description: Specifies the order in which to sort the results.

expand.description: Specifies the fields to expand in the response.

chainId.description: The chain ID. Must be a [supported chain](/development/chains).

account.description: Filter by account ID or developer account (starts with acc_ or dac_ respectively).

player.description: Filter by player ID (starts with pla_).

status.description: Filter by successful (1) or failed (0) transaction intents.

policy.description: Filter by policy ID (starts with pol_).

chainId.description: The chain ID. Must be a [supported chain](/development/chains).

player.description:
ID of the Player this TransactionIntent belongs to, if one exists (starts with `pla_`).

If you omit this parameter a new Player will be created.

account.description:
ID of the Account this TransactionIntent is executed with, if one exists (starts with `acc_` or `dac_`).

When providing a Player and ChainID, you can omit this parameter.

policy.description: ID of the Policy that defines the gas sponsorship strategy (starts with `pol_`). If no Policy is provided, the own Account native token funds will be used to pay for gas.

externalOwnerAddress.description:
Use this parameter to create a new Account for Player with the provided owner address.

If you omit this parameter and no Account exists for the Player, a custodial Account will be created.

optimistic.description: Set to `true` to indicate that the transactionIntent request should be resolved as soon as possible, after the transactionIntent is created and simulated and before it arrives on chain.

signedAuthorization.description:
Signed authorization for delegated accounts. This signature is used to authorize the user operation for AccountAbstractionV8.
The signature should be in the format "0x..." and will be parsed to extract r, s, and yParity values.

estimatedTXGasFee.description: estimated TX gas cost in the chain native token (WEI)

estimatedTXGasFeeUSD.description: estimated TX gas cost in USD

estimatedTXGasFeeToken.description: when using a policy, the estimated TX gas cost in the ERC-20 token defined in the strategy (WEI)

gasPrice.description: gas price used for the estimation

signature.description: signed userOperationHash by the owner or valid session key

optimistic.description: Set to `true` to indicate that the transactionIntent request should be resolved as soon as possible, after the transactionIntent is created and simulated and before it arrives on chain.

skip.description: Specifies the offset for the first records to return.

status.description: Specifies the status of the subscription logs

target.description: Specifies the target of the trigger

topic.description: Specifies the topic of the subscription

triggers.description: Specifies the triggers of the subscription

signature.description: Signature to verify the account ownership.

chainId.description: The chain ID.

name.description: The user readable name of signing domain, i.e. the name of the DApp or the protocol..

version.description: The current major version of the signing domain. Signatures from different versions are not compatible.

verifyingContract.description: The address of the contract that will verify the signature. The user-agent may do contract specific phishing prevention.

salt.description: An disambiguating salt for the protocol. This can be used as a domain separator of last resort.

hash.description: Hash to verify and that will be signed

validUntil.description: The unix timestamp in seconds when the session key expires.

whitelist.description: The list of whitelisted addresses (contracts the session key can interact with).

When providing a Player and ChainID, you can omit this parameter.

OnrampFee.description: Common fee structure for onramp operations

OnrampSessionResponse.description:
Common unified response format for creating an onramp session.
This format is provider-agnostic.

OnrampSessionRequest.description:
Common unified request format for creating an onramp session.
This format is provider-agnostic and will be adapted by each provider service.

OnrampQuoteResponse.description:
Common unified response format for getting an onramp quote.
This format is provider-agnostic.

OnrampQuotesResponse.description:
Response type for quote requests that can return either a single quote or multiple quotes.
- Returns OnrampQuoteResponse when provider is specified
- Returns OnrampQuoteResponse[] when provider is not specified

OnrampQuoteRequest.description:
Common unified request format for getting an onramp quote.
This format is provider-agnostic and will be adapted by each provider service.
If provider is specified, returns a single quote for that provider.
If provider is not specified, returns quotes from all available providers.

accountType.description: The type of smart account that will be created (e.g. UpgradeableV6, UpgradeableV5, ZKSyncUpgradeableV2). Defaults to UpgradeableV6.

defaultGuardian.description: For account types that support social recovery, wether to enable Openfort as guardian or not. Defaults to false.

externalUserId.description: Filter by external user ID (accountId from linked accounts).

walletClientType.description: Filter by wallet client type (for SIWE accounts).

custody.description: Indicates key custody: "Developer" for server-managed keys (WALLTEE), "User" for user-managed keys (DB).

recoveryShare.description:
The recovery share for the user's embedded signer.
This should be stored securely and provided to the user for account recovery.

ThirdPartyOAuthProvider.description: Enum of the supporting third party auth providers.

email.description:
The email address of the user to pregenerate.
Required if thirdPartyUserId is not provided.

thirdPartyUserId.description:
The third-party user ID from an external auth provider (Firebase, Supabase, etc.).
Required if email is not provided.

thirdPartyProvider.description: The third-party auth provider. Required when thirdPartyUserId is provided.

accountType.description:
The type of account to pregenerate. "Externally Owned Account", "Smart Account" or "Delegated Account".
Defaults to "Smart Account".

chainType.description: The chain type. "EVM" or "SVM". Defaults to "EVM".

chainId.description:
The chain ID. Required for Smart Account and Delegated Account types.
Must be a [supported chain](/development/chains).

implementationType.description:
The implementation type for Smart Account or Delegated Account (e.g. Calibur, UpgradeableV6).
Required for Smart Account and Delegated Account types.

accountType.description: The type of smart account that will be created. "Externally Owned Account", "Smart Account" or "Delegated Account".

address.description: The wallet address. For EOA: the EOA address. For Smart Account: the owner address (EOA will be created with this address). For Delegated Account: the address for both EOA and Delegated Account.

chainId.description: The chain ID. Must be a [supported chain](/development/chains). Required for Smart Account and Delegated Account types.

share.description: Specifies the share repositories. Required for creating embedded accounts.

implementationType.description: The type of smart account that will be created (e.g. UpgradeableV6, UpgradeableV5, Calibur, Simple). Defaults to UpgradeableV6 in mainnets. Must support EIP-7702 for Delegated Accounts.

chainType.description: The chain type the wallet is associated with.

custody.description: Key custody: always "Developer" for backend wallets (server-managed keys in TEE).

BackendWalletListQueries.description: Query parameters for listing backend wallets.

limit.description: Number of wallets to return (default: 10, max: 100).

skip.description: Number of wallets to skip (for pagination).

wallet.description: Filter by associated wallet ID (starts with `pla_`).

CreateBackendWalletResponse.description: Response from creating a new backend wallet account.

address.description: The wallet address generated for this account.

chainType.description: The chain type the wallet is associated with.

CreateBackendWalletRequest.description: Request to create a new backend wallet account.

chainType.description: The chain type for the new wallet.

wallet.description: The wallet ID to associate with this wallet (starts with `pla_`).

DeleteBackendWalletResponse.description: Response from deleting a backend wallet.

SignResponse.description: Response from signing data via backend wallet.

account.description: The account ID that signed the data (starts with `acc_`).

SignRequest.description: Request to sign data via backend wallet.

data.description: The data to sign (hex-encoded transaction data or message hash).

ExportPrivateKeyResponse.description: Response from exporting a private key with E2E encryption.

encryptedPrivateKey.description:
The private key encrypted with RSA-OAEP SHA-256 using your ephemeral public key (base64-encoded).
Decrypt using your ephemeral RSA private key.

ExportPrivateKeyRequest.description: Request to export private key with E2E encryption.

encryptionKey.description:
Client's ephemeral RSA-4096 public key for end-to-end encryption (base64 SPKI DER format).
The backend wallet will encrypt the private key using RSA-OAEP SHA-256.

ImportPrivateKeyResponse.description: Response from importing a private key with E2E encryption.

address.description: The wallet address derived from the imported private key.

chainType.description: The chain type the wallet is associated with.

ImportPrivateKeyRequest.description: Request to import private key with E2E encryption.

encryptedPrivateKey.description:
The private key encrypted with RSA-OAEP SHA-256 using the server's static import public key.
Obtain the server's import public key out-of-band (e.g., from SDK or documentation).

chainType.description: The chain type for the imported wallet.

wallet.description: The wallet ID to associate with this wallet (starts with `pla_`).

name.description: Optional name for the imported wallet.

RegisterWalletSecretResponse.description: Response from registering a new wallet secret.

keyId.description: The key ID for the registered secret.

registeredAt.description: Timestamp when the secret was registered (Unix epoch seconds).

RegisterWalletSecretRequest.description:
Request to register a new wallet secret (authentication key).

Uses provided-key authentication: the walletAuthToken JWT must be signed by
the private key corresponding to the publicKey being registered.

publicKey.description:
ECDSA P-256 public key for wallet authentication (PEM format).
This will be used to verify X-Wallet-Auth JWT signatures.

walletAuthToken.description:
JWT signed with the private key corresponding to publicKey.
This proves possession of the private key without transmitting it.

JWT must include: uris (matching request path), reqHash (SHA-256 of request body),
iat (issued at), nbf (not before), and optionally exp (expiration).

keyId.description:
Key identifier for the secret.
Used to identify this key in X-Wallet-Auth JWT headers.

RevokeWalletSecretResponse.description: Response from revoking a wallet secret.

keyId.description: The key ID of the revoked secret.

revoked.description: Whether the secret was successfully revoked.

revokedAt.description: Timestamp when the secret was revoked (Unix epoch seconds).

RevokeWalletSecretRequest.description: Request to revoke a wallet secret (authentication key).

keyId.description: Key identifier of the secret to revoke.

RotateWalletSecretResponse.description: Response from rotating a wallet secret.

rotatedAt.description: Timestamp when the rotation occurred (Unix epoch seconds).

RotateWalletSecretRequest.description:
Request to rotate wallet secret (authentication key).

Uses provided-key authentication: the walletAuthToken JWT must be signed by
the private key corresponding to the newPublicKey being registered.

newPublicKey.description:
New ECDSA P-256 public key for wallet authentication (PEM format).
This will replace the current wallet secret used for X-Wallet-Auth JWT signing.

walletAuthToken.description:
JWT signed with the private key corresponding to newPublicKey.
This proves possession of the private key without transmitting it.

JWT must include: uris (matching request path), reqHash (SHA-256 of request body),
iat (issued at), nbf (not before), and optionally exp (expiration).

newKeyId.description:
Key identifier for the new secret.
Used to identify this key in X-Wallet-Auth JWT headers.

custody.description: Indicates key custody: "Developer" for server-managed keys (WALLTEE), "User" for user-managed keys (DB).

limit.description: Specifies the maximum number of records to return.

skip.description: Specifies the offset for the first records to return.

order.description: Specifies the order in which to sort the results.

chainId.description: The chain ID. Must be a [supported chain](/development/chains).

user.description: Specifies the unique user ID (starts with pla_)

chainType.description: The chain type. Must be either "EVM" or "SVM".

accountType.description: Specifies the type of account. Must be either "Smart Account" or "Externally Owned Account".

custody.description: Specifies the key custody of the account. Must be either "Developer" or "User".

chainId.description: The target chain ID. Must be a [supported chain](/development/chains).

accountType.description: The type of smart account that will be created. "Externally Owned Account", "Smart Account" or "Delegated Account".

implementationType.description: The type of smart account that will be created (e.g. UpgradeableV6, UpgradeableV5, Calibur). Defaults to UpgradeableV6 in mainnets.

chainId.description: The chain ID. Must be a [supported chain](/development/chains).

user.description: ID of the user this account belongs to (starts with `usr_`). If none is provided, a new user will be created.

account.description: ID of the account (starts with `acc_`) to be linked with. Required for accountType "Smart Account".

email.description: The email of the user to add.

pkPolicy.description: The private key policyfor the project.

primaryColorForeground.description: Primary color foreground of the ecosystem.

ecosystemWalletDomains.description: Whitelisted frontend domains of the ecosystem.

primaryColorForeground.description: Primary color foreground of the ecosystem.

MappingStrategy.description:
Mapping strategy for the migration. This is used to transform the ids between the source and destination providers.
For the transformation, the order of the operations is:
1. Trim the prefix and suffix from the destination id.
2. Add the prefix and suffix to the destination id.
When a user is authenticated in the destination provider, the id is transformed using the mapping strategy to find if exists in the source provider.
If the id is not found, the user is created in the destination provider.
If the id is found, the user in the destination provider is linked to the source provider.

trimPrefix.description: Prefix to trim from the destination id.

trimSuffix.description: Suffix to trim from the destination id.

addPrefix.description: Prefix to add to the destination id.

addSuffix.description: Suffix to add to the destination id.

sourceProvider.description: The source provider for the migration.

destinationProvider.description: The destination provider for the migration.

createdAt.description: The created date of the migration.

finishedAt.description: If the migration is finished, this will be the date it was finished.

mappingStrategy.description:
The mapping strategy used for the migration.
If not provided, the direct mapping will be used.

The mapping strategy used for the migration.
If not provided, the direct mapping will be used.

CreateMigrationRequest.description: Request for migrating authentication from one provider to another

limit.description: Specifies the maximum number of records to return.

skip.description: Specifies the offset for the first records to return.

order.description: Specifies the order in which to sort the results.

mappingStrategy.description:
The mapping strategy used for the migration.
If not provided, the direct mapping will be used.

UpdateMigrationRequest.description: Request for update the status of a migration

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

limit.description: Specifies the maximum number of records to return.

skip.description: Specifies the offset for the first records to return.

order.description: Specifies the order in which to sort the results.

email.description: Specifies the email address of the user.

authorizationCode.description: The authorization code received from the api to authorize the project to use the Ecosystem player.

info.title: Openfort API
info.description: Complete Openfort API references and guides can be found at: https://www.openfort.io/docs

post.description:
Execute Solana JSON-RPC 2.0 methods via Kora

This endpoint handles Solana-specific JSON-RPC 2.0 requests for gasless transactions
using the Kora paymaster service.

**Supported clusters:**
- `mainnet-beta` - Solana mainnet-beta
- `devnet` - Solana devnet

**Supported methods (per Kora JSON-RPC API spec):**
- `getConfig`: Retrieve Kora server configuration
- `getPayerSigner`: Get fee payer signer and payment destination
- `getSupportedTokens`: List tokens accepted for fee payment
- `getBlockhash`: Get latest blockhash
- `estimateTransactionFee`: Estimate fees in lamports and token
- `transferTransaction`: Create token transfer with Kora as fee payer
- `signTransaction`: Sign transaction without broadcasting
- `signAndSendTransaction`: Sign and broadcast to Solana

Execute JSON-RPC 2.0 wallet methods

This endpoint handles wallet-namespace JSON-RPC 2.0 requests following the specification at https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification.
It supports EIP-7811 wallet methods that operate across multiple chains.

**Supported methods:**
- `wallet_getAssets`: Retrieve wallet assets across multiple chains with optional filtering

**Authentication:**
Supports multiple authentication methods including public key access tokens and third-party tokens

Execute chain-specific JSON-RPC 2.0 methods (bundler & paymaster)

This endpoint handles chain-specific JSON-RPC 2.0 requests for ERC-4337 bundler operations and ERC-7677 paymaster operations.
The chainId is specified in the URL path following the standard pattern.

**Supported namespaces:**
- `eth_*`: ERC-4337 bundler methods (sendUserOperation, estimateUserOperationGas, getUserOperationReceipt, getUserOperationByHash, supportedEntryPoints)
- `openfort_*`: Openfort bundler extensions (getUserOperationGasPrice, getUserOperationStatus)
- `pm_*`: ERC-7677 paymaster methods (getPaymasterStubData, getPaymasterData)
- `wallet_*`: EIP-7811 wallet methods (can also be called here with chainId context)
post.summary: Execute chain-specific bundler and paymaster JSON-RPC methods

get.description: Returns a list of TransactionIntents.

parameters.name: account

parameters.description: Filter by player ID (starts with pla_).
parameters.name: player

parameters.description: Filter by successful (1) or failed (0) transaction intents.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Filter by policy ID (starts with pol_).
parameters.name: policy

post.description:
Creates a TransactionIntent.

A pending TransactionIntent has the `response` attribute as undefined.

After the TransactionIntent is created and broadcasted to the blockchain, `response` will be populated with the transaction hash and a status (1 success, 0 fail).

When using a non-custodial account, a `nextAction` attribute is returned with the `userOperationHash` that must be signed by the owner of the account.

get.description: Retrieves the details of a TransactionIntent that has previously been created.

parameters.description: Specifies the unique transaction intent ID (starts with tin_).
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Specifies the expandable fields.
parameters.name: expand

post.description:
Estimate the gas cost of broadcasting a TransactionIntent.

This is a simulation, it does not send the transaction on-chain.

If a Policy ID is used that includes payment of gas in ERC-20 tokens, an extra field `estimatedTXGasFeeToken` is returned with the estimated amount of tokens that will be used.
post.summary: Estimate gas cost of creating a transaction

post.description:
Broadcasts a signed TransactionIntent to the blockchain.

Use this endpoint to send the signed `signableHash`. Openfort will then put it on-chain.

parameters.description: Specifies the unique transaction intent ID (starts with tin_).
parameters.name: id

get.description:
Returns a list of subscriptions for the given project.

This object represents the subscriptions where the project owner has subscribed to.

Subscriptions are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created subscriptions appearing first.

By default, a maximum of 10 subscriptions are shown per page.

This object represents the subscription where the project owner has subscribed to.

post.description:
This endpoint allows you to perform a request to change the owner of an account.
To perform an update on the owner of an account, first you must provide a new owner address.
Once requested, the owner must accept to take ownership by calling `acceptOwnership()` in the smart contract account.

parameters.name: id

post.description: This endpoint allows you to cancel a pending transfer of ownership.

400.description: Bad request - missing required fields or invalid parameters.

post.description:
Creates an onramp session for the selected provider.

The provider is selected via the `provider` field. All request and response formats are unified
and provider-agnostic. The service layer handles translation between the common format and
provider-specific APIs.

400.description: Bad request - missing required fields or invalid parameters.

post.description:
Retrieves onramp quote(s) without creating an actual transaction.

If provider is specified, returns a single quote for that provider.
If provider is not specified, returns quotes from all available providers.

All request and response formats are unified and provider-agnostic.

parameters.description: Specifies the unique project ID.
parameters.name: id

get.description:
Returns a list of accounts for the given player.

This object represents a player's account, which is a blockchain smart account that can be used to interact with the blockchain.

The accounts are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created accounts appearing first.

Returns the latest 10 transaction intents for each account.

By default, a maximum of 10 accounts are shown per page.

post.description:
Creates a new blockchain account for the provided player. If not player is provided, a new one will be created.

Account creation does not consume any gas. All accounts of a player will use the same address across blockchains.

Each player can only have one account per chain.

get.description:
Retrieves the details of an existing account.

Supply the unique account ID from either a account creation request or the account list, and Openfort will return the corresponding account information.

Returns the latest 10 transaction intents created by this account.

parameters.description: Specifies the unique account ID (starts with acc_).
parameters.name: id

post.description:
Disables an account.

Accounts won't be shown for user and won't be accessible for transactions.

To perform an update on the owner of an account, first you must provide a new owner address.
Once requested, the owner must accept to take ownership by calling `acceptOwnership()` in the smart contract account.

get.description:
Retrieves an authenticated user.

Users have linked accounts and are authenticated with a provider.

delete.description:
It will delete all linked accounts the user is authenticated with.
If the user has a linked embedded signer, it will be deleted as well.

parameters.description: Specifies the unique user ID (starts with pla_).
parameters.name: id

get.description: Retrieves the wallet associated with an authenticated user.

409.description: Conflict - user with this identifier already exists.

post.description:
Pre-generate a user with an embedded account before they authenticate.
Creates a user record and an embedded account using the provided SSS key shares.
When the user later authenticates (via email, OAuth, third-party auth, etc.)
with the same identifier, they will be linked to this pre-generated account.

You can pregenerate using either:
- `email`: User will be linked when they authenticate with the same email
- `thirdPartyUserId` + `thirdPartyProvider`: User will be linked when they authenticate via the same third-party provider
post.summary: Pre-generate a user with an embedded account.

get.description:
List backend wallets.

Returns a paginated list of backend wallets for the project.

parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Number of wallets to skip (for pagination).
parameters.name: skip

parameters.description: Filter by chain type.
parameters.name: chainType

parameters.description: Filter by wallet address.
parameters.name: address

parameters.description: Filter by wallet name.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Filter by associated wallet ID (starts with `pla_`).
parameters.name: wallet

post.description:
Create a new backend wallet account.

Generates a new keypair securely in the backend wallet system.
The private key is stored encrypted and never exposed.

get.description:
Get backend wallet details.

Returns details for a specific backend wallet.

parameters.description: The wallet ID (starts with acc_).
parameters.name: id

delete.description:
Delete a backend wallet.

Permanently deletes a backend wallet and its associated private key.

parameters.description: The wallet ID (starts with acc_).
parameters.name: id

post.description:
Sign data via backend wallet.

Signs the provided data using the account's private key managed by the backend wallet.
The private key is securely stored and never exposed.

parameters.description: The account ID (starts with acc_).
parameters.name: id

post.description:
Export private key with E2E encryption via backend wallet.

Exports the account's private key encrypted using RSA-4096 OAEP SHA-256.
The client must provide their ephemeral RSA-4096 public key (base64 SPKI DER format).
The response contains the encrypted private key that can be decrypted with the client's private key.

parameters.description: The account ID (starts with acc_).
parameters.name: id

post.description:
Import private key with E2E encryption via backend wallet.

Imports a private key into the backend wallet system.
The private key must be encrypted using RSA-4096 OAEP SHA-256 with the server's
static import public key (obtain out-of-band from SDK or documentation).

Register a new wallet secret (authentication key).

Registers an ECDSA P-256 public key that will be used to verify
X-Wallet-Auth JWT signatures. This is required before using WALLET_AUTH
for other backend wallet operations.

Uses provided-key authentication: the request must include a walletAuthToken
JWT signed by the private key corresponding to the publicKey being registered.
This proves possession of the private key without transmitting it.

Note: Only ONE active secret is allowed per project. This call fails if an
active secret already exists; use rotateWalletSecret to replace an existing secret.

Revoke a wallet secret (authentication key).

Permanently revokes a wallet secret so it can no longer be used
for X-Wallet-Auth JWT signing.

Rotate wallet secret (authentication key).

Replaces the current wallet secret (ECDSA P-256 public key) used for
X-Wallet-Auth JWT signing. The old secret will be marked as "rotated"
and immediately becomes unusable (no grace period).

Uses provided-key authentication: the request must include a walletAuthToken
JWT signed by the private key corresponding to the NEW publicKey being registered.
This proves possession of the new private key without transmitting it.

get.description:
Returns a list of accounts for the given user.

This object represents a user's account, which is a blockchain smart account that can be used to interact with the blockchain.

The accounts are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created accounts appearing first.

parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of records to return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Specifies the offset for the first records to return.
parameters.name: skip

parameters.description: Specifies the order in which to sort the results.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: The chain ID. Must be a [supported chain](/development/chains).
parameters.name: chainId

parameters.description: Specifies the unique user ID (starts with pla_)
parameters.name: user

parameters.description: The chain type. Must be either "EVM" or "SVM".
parameters.name: chainType

parameters.description: Specifies the type of account. Must be either "Smart Account" or "Externally Owned Account".
parameters.name: accountType

parameters.description: Specifies the key custody of the account. Must be either "Developer" or "User".
parameters.name: custody

parameters.description: Specifies the account address
parameters.name: address

post.description:
Creates a new blockchain account for a user.

Account creation does not consume any gas. The account can be used to interact with the blockchain.

get.description: Retrieves the signer ID associated with a given blockchain address.

Retrieves the details of an existing account.

Supply the unique account ID and Openfort will return the corresponding account information.

delete.description: Removes an account from a project.

post.description:
Switches the blockchain network for an existing account.

This allows moving an account between different blockchain networks while maintaining the same account identity.
